# 3.0.5 (opens new window) (2020-12-30)

Note: this release contains a type-only change that requires TypeScript 4.0+, which may cause build issues in projects still using TS 3.x.

# Bug Fixes

  • compiler-core: fix missing createVNode import on nested v-for (ad4d391 (opens new window)), closes #2718 (opens new window)
  • compiler-sfc: should keep template nodes with no content (#2468 (opens new window)) (5b9b37f (opens new window)), closes #2463 (opens new window)
  • compiler-sfc: support transforming asset urls with full base url. (#2477 (opens new window)) (db786b1 (opens new window))
  • runtime-core: component mount anchor memory leak (#2459 (opens new window)) (3867bb4 (opens new window)), closes #2458 (opens new window)
  • runtime-core: skip patchBlockChildren if n1.dynamicChildren is null (#2717 (opens new window)) (c59897c (opens new window)), closes #2715 (opens new window) #2485 (opens new window)
  • runtime-dom: support mounting app on ShadowRoot (#2447 (opens new window)) (b2189ba (opens new window)), closes #2399 (opens new window)
  • ssr: properly handle ssr empty slot and fallback (88f6b33 (opens new window))
  • transition: ensure manual style manipulation in transition leave hooks work (cbaa380 (opens new window)), closes #2720 (opens new window)
  • transition: ensure styles from *-leave-active trigger transition (#2716 (opens new window)) (3f8f9b6 (opens new window)), closes #2712 (opens new window)

# Features

  • devtools: send instance (3626ff0 (opens new window))

# 3.0.4 (opens new window) (2020-12-02)

# Bug Fixes

  • async-component: forward refs on async component wrapper (64d4681 (opens new window)), closes #2671 (opens new window)
  • attr-fallthrough: ensure consistent attr fallthrough for root fragments with comments (3bc2914 (opens new window)), closes #2549 (opens new window)
  • build: enable safari10 option for terser (#2472 (opens new window)) (20a704f (opens new window)), closes #2470 (opens new window)
  • compiler-core: fix scope var reference check for v-on expressions (9db7095 (opens new window)), closes #2564 (opens new window)
  • compiler-core: fix unintended imports in esm-bundler builds (55d99d7 (opens new window)), closes #2258 (opens new window) #2515 (opens new window)
  • compiler-core: transform kebab case props to camelcase on slots (#2490 (opens new window)) (ef59a30 (opens new window)), closes #2488 (opens new window)
  • compiler-core/v-on: handle falsy values when caching v-on handlers (e4f09c1 (opens new window)), closes #2605 (opens new window)
  • compiler-sfc: fix parsing error when lang="" is used on plain element (#2569 (opens new window)) (5f2a853 (opens new window)), closes #2566 (opens new window)
  • compiler-sfc: named imports from .vue file should not be treated as constant (085bbd5 (opens new window)), closes #2699 (opens new window)
  • compiler-sfc: should not remove import statements with no specifier when compiling script setup (43eab92 (opens new window))
  • compiler-ssr: generate correct children for transition-group (a5d6f80 (opens new window)), closes #2510 (opens new window)
  • compiler-ssr: handle v-model checkbox with true-value binding (fe5428d (opens new window))
  • compiler-ssr: should not render key/ref bindings in ssr (5b62662 (opens new window))
  • provide: support symbols in applyOptions (#2616 (opens new window)) (7a1a782 (opens new window)), closes #2615 (opens new window)
  • reactivity: ensure readonly on plain arrays doesn't track array methods. (#2506 (opens new window)) (3470308 (opens new window)), closes #2493 (opens new window)
  • reactivity: ensure add/set on reactive collections return the proxy (#2534 (opens new window)) (6e46a57 (opens new window)), closes #2530 (opens new window)
  • runtime-core: ensure keep-alive deep-watches include/explude props (#2551 (opens new window)) (421205d (opens new window)), closes #2550 (opens new window)
  • runtime-core: ensure watchers are always registered to correct instance owner (#2495 (opens new window)) (735af1c (opens new window)), closes #2381 (opens new window)
  • runtime-core: fix emit listener check on kebab-case events (#2542 (opens new window)) (3532b2b (opens new window)), closes #2540 (opens new window)
  • runtime-core: handle static node move in production (bf16a57 (opens new window))
  • runtime-core: remove static node in production mode (#2556 (opens new window)) (2a9ba0c (opens new window)), closes #2553 (opens new window)
  • runtime-core: should pause tracking when initializing legacy options (#2524 (opens new window)) (0ff2a4f (opens new window)), closes #2521 (opens new window)
  • runtime-core: skip functional components in public $parent chain traversal (53f4885 (opens new window)), closes #2437 (opens new window)
  • runtime-dom: attribute should be removed with nullish values (#2679 (opens new window)) (fb6b9f8 (opens new window)), closes #2677 (opens new window)
  • script-setup: ensure useContext() return valid context (73cdb9d (opens new window))
  • slots: dynamically named slots should be keyed by name (2ab8c41 (opens new window)), closes #2535 (opens new window)
  • slots: should render fallback content when slot content contains no valid nodes (#2485 (opens new window)) (ce4915d (opens new window)), closes #2347 (opens new window) #2461 (opens new window)
  • suspense: fix nested async child toggle inside already resovled suspense (cf7f1db (opens new window)), closes #2215 (opens new window)
  • teleport: Teleport into SVG elements (#2648 (opens new window)) (cd92836 (opens new window)), closes #2652 (opens new window)
  • transition: avoid invoking stale transition end callbacks (eaf8a67 (opens new window)), closes #2482 (opens new window)
  • transition: respect rules in *-leave-from transition class (#2597 (opens new window)) (e2618a6 (opens new window)), closes #2593 (opens new window)
  • types: fix ToRefs type on union value types (e315d84 (opens new window)), closes #2687 (opens new window)
  • v-model: avoid mutation when using Set models + fix multi select Set model update (f2b0a8e (opens new window))
  • v-model: respect checkbox true-value/false-value on initial render (48f00c0 (opens new window)), closes #2694 (opens new window)
  • v-show: ensure v-show conflict with inline string style binding (3cd30c5 (opens new window)), closes #2583 (opens new window)
  • allow hmr in all builds (46d80f4 (opens new window)), closes #2571 (opens new window)

# Features

  • sfc: allow sfcs to recursively self-reference in template via name inferred from filename (67d1aac (opens new window))

# 3.0.3 (opens new window) (2020-11-25)

# Bug Fixes

  • compiler-core/compiler-sfc: handle destructure assignment expressions (4c6078c (opens new window))
  • compiler-sfc: fix script setup ts helpers (6e3abc8 (opens new window))
  • hmr: fix updates for imported but not yet rendered components (9c23ddf (opens new window))
  • runtime-core: components with static props and slots should not be force updated (51e43e0 (opens new window))
  • runtime-core: ensure scheduler queue is always non-null (#2567 (opens new window)) (af95604 (opens new window))
  • runtime-dom: use correct import source (f28ca55 (opens new window))
  • style-vars: apply css vars in post flush effect (3a6b120 (opens new window))
  • handle case of ref declaration without initial value (8485cd4 (opens new window))
  • types: ensure correct type for toRef and toRefs on existing refs (8e20375 (opens new window))

# Experimental Features

Note: support for experimental features in SFCs have been updated according to changes in ongoing RFCs. This release may break existing usage of such experimental features.

  • compiler-sfc: compileScript inline render function mode (886ed76 (opens new window))
  • compiler-sfc: new script setup implementation (556560f (opens new window))
  • compiler-sfc: new SFC css varaible injection implementation (41bb7fa (opens new window))
  • compiler-sfc: support kebab-case components in <script setup> sfc template (3f99e23 (opens new window))
  • runtime-core: explicit expose API (0e59770 (opens new window))

# Reverts

  • Revert "wip: allow scriptCompiled to be cached on sfc descriptor" (9db4288 (opens new window))

# 3.0.0 (opens new window) (2020-09-18)

# 3.0.0-rc.13 (opens new window) (2020-09-18)

# Bug Fixes

  • hmr: make hmr working with class components (#2144 (opens new window)) (422f05e (opens new window))
  • reactivity: avoid length mutating array methods causing infinite updates (#2138 (opens new window)) (f316a33 (opens new window)), closes #2137 (opens new window)
  • suspense: should discard unmount effects of invalidated pending branch (5bfcad1 (opens new window))
  • types: component instance inference without props (#2145 (opens new window)) (57bdaa2 (opens new window))

# Code Refactoring

  • watch APIs default to trigger pre-flush (49bb447 (opens new window)), closes /github.com/vuejs/vue-next/issues/1706#issuecomment-666258948 (opens new window)

# Features

  • runtime-core: support using inject() inside props default functions (58c31e3 (opens new window))
  • watch: support dot-delimited path in watch option (1c9a0b3 (opens new window))

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • watch APIs now default to use flush: 'pre' instead of flush: 'post'. This change affects watch, watchEffect, the watch component option, and this.$watch. See (49bb447 (opens new window)) for more details.

# 3.0.0-beta.1 (opens new window) (2020-04-16)

  • reactivity: adjust APIs (09b4202 (opens new window))

  • runtime-core: skip emit warn if has equivalent onXXX prop (0709380 (opens new window))

# Performance Improvements

  • runtime-core: use raw context on component options init (bfd6744 (opens new window))

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • reactivity: Reactivity APIs adjustments:

  • readonly is now non-tracking if called on plain objects. lock and unlock have been removed. A readonly proxy can no longer be directly mutated. However, it can still wrap an already reactive object and track changes to the source reactive object.

  • isReactive now only returns true for proxies created by reactive, or a readonly proxy that wraps a reactive proxy.

  • A new utility isProxy is introduced, which returns true for both reactive or readonly proxies.

  • markNonReactive has been renamed to markRaw.

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • reactivity: markReadonly has been removed.

  • runtime-dom: Only props starting with on followed by an uppercase letter or a non-letter character are considered event listeners.

For logic that relies on return value of listeners, the listener should be declared as an onXXX prop and be called directly. This still allows the parent component to pass in a handler using v-on, since v-on:foo internally compiles to onFoo.

    ref: https://github.com/vuejs/rfcs/pull/16

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • runtime-core: adjust attr fallthrough behavior

    Updated per pending RFC https://github.com/vuejs/rfcs/pull/137

    • Implicit fallthrough now by default only applies for a whitelist of attributes (class, style, event listeners, a11y attributes, and data attributes).

    • Fallthrough is now applied regardless of whether the component has

  • runtime-core: revert setup() result reactive conversion

    Revert 6b10f0c & a840e7d. The motivation of the original change was avoiding unnecessary deep conversions, but that can be achieved by explicitly marking values non-reactive via markNonReactive.

    Removing the reactive conversion behavior leads to an usability issue in that plain objects containing refs (which is what most composition functions will return), when exposed as a nested property from setup(), will not unwrap the refs in templates. This goes against the "no .value in template" intuition and the only workaround requires users to manually wrap it again with reactive().

    So in this commit we are reverting to the previous behavior where objects returned from setup() are implicitly wrapped with reactive() for deep ref unwrapping.

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • directives: custom directive bindings no longer expose instance

    This is a rarely used property that creates extra complexity in ensuring it points to the correct instance. From a design perspective, a custom directive should be scoped to the element and data it is bound to and should not have access to the entire instance in the first place.

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • runtime-core: replace watch(fn, options?) with watchEffect

    The watch(fn, options?) signature has been replaced by the new watchEffect API, which has the same usage and behavior. watch now only supports the watch(source, cb, options?) signature.

  • reactivity: reactive arrays no longer unwraps contained refs

    When reactive arrays contain refs, especially a mix of refs and plain values, Array prototype methods will fail to function properly - e.g. sort() or reverse() will overwrite the ref's value instead of moving it (see #737).

    Ensuring correct behavior for all possible Array methods while retaining the ref unwrapping behavior is exceedingly complicated; In addition, even if Vue handles the built-in methods internally, it would still break when the user attempts to use a 3rd party utility function (e.g. lodash) on a reactive array containing refs.

    After this commit, similar to other collection types like Map and Set, Arrays will no longer automatically unwrap contained refs.

    The usage of mixed refs and plain values in Arrays should be rare in practice. In cases where this is necessary, the user can create a computed property that performs the unwrapping.

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • watch: watch behavior has been adjusted.

    • When using the watch(source, callback, options?) signature, the callback now fires lazily by default (consistent with 2.x behavior).

      Note that the watch(effect, options?) signature is still eager, since it must invoke the effect immediately to collect dependencies.

    • The lazy option has been replaced by the opposite immediate option, which defaults to false. (It's ignored when using the effect signature)

    • Due to the above changes, the watch option in Options API now behaves exactly the same as 2.x.

    • When using the effect signature or { immediate: true }, the initial execution is now performed synchronously instead of deferred until the component is mounted. This is necessary for certain use cases to work properly with async setup() and Suspense.

      The side effect of this is the immediate watcher invocation will no longer have access to the mounted DOM. However, the watcher can be initiated inside onMounted to retain previous behavior.

# 3.0.0-alpha.4 (opens new window) (2020-01-27)

# Bug Fixes

  • reactivity: Array methods relying on identity should work with raw values (aefb7d2 (opens new window))
  • runtime-core: instance should not expose non-declared props (2884831 (opens new window))
  • runtime-dom: should not access document in non-browser env (48152bc (opens new window)), closes #657 (opens new window)
  • v-model/emit: update:camelCase events should trigger kebab case equivalent (2837ce8 (opens new window)), closes #656 (opens new window)

# Code Refactoring

  • adjust createApp related API signatures (c07751f (opens new window))
  • remove implicit reactive() call on renderContext (6b10f0c (opens new window))

# Performance Improvements

  • ssr: avoid unnecessary async overhead (297282a (opens new window))

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • object returned from setup() are no longer implicitly passed to reactive().

    The renderContext is the object returned by setup() (or a new object if no setup() is present). Before this change, it was implicitly passed to reactive() for ref unwrapping. But this has the side effect of unnecessary deep reactive conversion on properties that should not be made reactive (e.g. computed return values and injected non-reactive objects), and can lead to performance issues.

    This change removes the reactive() call and instead performs a shallow ref unwrapping at the render proxy level. The breaking part is when the user returns an object with a plain property from setup(), e.g. return { count: 0 }, this property will no longer trigger updates when mutated by a in-template event handler. Instead, explicit refs are required.

    This also means that any objects not explicitly made reactive in setup() will remain non-reactive. This can be desirable when exposing heavy external stateful objects on this.

  • createApp API has been adjusted.

    • createApp() now accepts the root component, and optionally a props object to pass to the root component.
    • app.mount() now accepts a single argument (the root container)
    • app.unmount() no longer requires arguments.

    New behavior looks like the following:

    const app = createApp(RootComponent)
app.mount('#app')
app.unmount()
    1
    2
    3
